title: Chibis?
author: JGray
text:
We haven't seen the chibis in a while. In fact, after some negative feedback I had gotten on their use, I hadn't planned on using them again. Then this chance for a neat little joke came up... something that wouldn't be in character for Chrys to say. That's what the chibis were made for. So, I brought them back to life.

What do you think? Are chibis a fun little aside? Or an annoying distraction from the storyline?

replies.author: J*Guest*
replies.text: Fun little aside when used right

replies.author: Ketira*Guest*
replies.text: I agree with "guest J" - they bring a bit of comedy relief to an otherwise serious situation.  And in this case, it fits right into the storyline!

replies.author: Ayshara*Guest*
replies.text: I liked them and still do, please continue.

replies.author: adamas*Guest*
replies.text: Considering her line? Pretty much perfect.

replies.author: Richard*Guest*
replies.text: When used sparingly, I'm ok with chibis. And in a situation like this, they make sense.

replies.author: Mei*Guest*
replies.text: i love her use. but you should have given her super anime eyes }

replies.author: Uatchti*Guest*
replies.text: Is Mandrake shrinking, or her dress is growing? On the station it was a mini dress, coming to the top of her thigh. In Morks it was halfway down her thigh. And now it  goes down past her knees?

replies.author: Antonious*Guest*
replies.text: A fun aside. They get to say and do things the real character never would.

replies.author: Felix Ple»ôoianu*Guest*
replies.text: +1 for chibis, when appropriate. And here it's very appropriate!

replies.author: JGray
replies.text:
Uatchi, her dress is getting longer. That's a feature. It turns from a mini-dress into an evening dress, then shrinks back again.

Yep. That's my explanation and I'm sticking to it.
